sen.j: 伊原 敏郎（いはら としお）、明治3年4月24日 (旧暦)（1870年5月24日） - 昭和16年（1941年）7月26日）は、演劇評論家、劇作家。
sen.e: Toshio IHARA (May 24, 1870 - July 26, 1941) was a play critic and a playwright.
Toshio IHARA (May 24, 1870 - July 26, 1941) was a dramatic critic and playwright.
sen.cmt: play critic -> dramatic critica playwright -> playwright
sen.e: Toshio IHARA (May 24, 1870 - July 26, 1941) was a dramatic critic and playwright.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: He was born in Matsue City.
He was born in Matsue City.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 筆名に青々園（せいせいえん）の筆名を使用したため、伊原青々園円としても知られる。
sen.e: He is known as Seiseien IHARA because he wrote under the pseudonym, Seiseien.
He is also known as Seiseien IHARA because his pen name was Seiseien.

sen.j: 第一高等学校 (旧制)中退、1893年二六新報に入社、青々園の名で劇評を書く。
sen.e: He joined Niroku Shinpo in 1893 to write stage reviews under the name of Seiseien, after he dropped out of Daiichi High School (the first old-education-system high school).
sen.cmt: 「二六新報」の定訳不明

sen.e: He became close to Shoyo TSUBOUCHI and joined Miyako Shinbun (Miyako Newspaper) in 1896.

sen.j: 『日本演劇史』『近世日本演劇史』『明治演劇史』三部作で1933年朝日文化賞を受賞。
sen.e: He received the Asahi Shinbun Cultural Award in 1933 for his trilogy, "Japanese Theatrical History", "Modern Japanese Theatrical History", and "Theatrical History in the Meiji Period".
